title: yuriagpalo
author: yuriagpalo
content: Hey guys, just wanna ask, what do you think is the best crypto portfolio for a $30k fund?Cheers!

comments.author: SafuBTC
comments.body: BTC and ETH taking the 50$ of the fund, layer 1&2 projects with mixed of metaverse and Dao project will make a fine and profitable portfolio, as for the names of the other projects you need to do your own research, but be rest assured that BTC and ETH will never disappoint.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: yuriagpalo on August 23, 2022, 07:25:33 AMHey guys, just wanna ask, what do you think is the best crypto portfolio for a $30k fund?Cheers!It varies depending on your risk policy and whether this amount is worth a lot to you or is it just a side investment and don't be afraid to lose.Mostly, investing in digital currencies is a high-risk investment and leads to real profits if you do not have a good background in investing, high-risk investments, or your investment is short-term or tied to a certain date.As for the long-term investment, Bitcoin has historically proven to be an excellent long-term investment, and this applies to a few cryptocurrencies, but I do not advise you to stay away from investing.A policy of 30% stablecoins, 40% Bitcoin, 19% Ethereum and the rest for a few investments seems like a good idea to me.

comments.author: ethereumhunter
comments.body: Quote from: yuriagpalo on August 23, 2022, 07:25:33 AMHey guys, just wanna ask, what do you think is the best crypto portfolio for a $30k fund?Cheers!If I were you and had $30k in cash, I would allocate a large amount of money to invest in bitcoin, maybe half or more of that amount. I'll pick ethereum, bnb, ada, and a few other coins for the rest of the coins and hold them until the altcoin season returns.By investing in bitcoin, say as much as $15k, I will have the opportunity to make a big profit because with $15k, I can earn around 0.4 btc or more. And when the bitcoin price starts to rally again, I will make a profit of over $15k.

comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: Depends on your preferences, risk tolerance and selected timeframe I guess?In my portfolio, I only have bitcoin, ethereum and monero simply because they are the only project that makes sense to me especially with their respective  use-cases. Plus, the parameters like their community, purpose, and the tech behind the project is what sets these coins to survive in the long haul, which is in retrospect fits long tern investing.That's just me though. You needed to assess yourself first, because what works for might not work for you.

comments.author: tbct_mt2
comments.body: Quote from: yuriagpalo on August 23, 2022, 07:25:33 AMwhat do you think is the best crypto portfolio for a $30k fund?$30k fund is good enough.How long will you plan to not touch it?Do you have other financial resources that you can use for your life without touching $30k? If you have other resources, you can invest the $30k in long term. If it is a long term investment, I would pick Bitcoin and Ethereum. If you want to diversify more, BNB.It should be 2 years or longer because investment in bear market will bring short term loss.

comments.author: m2017
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on August 23, 2022, 10:36:47 AMQuote from: yuriagpalo on August 23, 2022, 07:25:33 AMHey guys, just wanna ask, what do you think is the best crypto portfolio for a $30k fund?Cheers!It varies depending on your risk policy and whether this amount is worth a lot to you or is it just a side investment and don't be afraid to lose.Mostly, investing in digital currencies is a high-risk investment and leads to real profits if you do not have a good background in investing, high-risk investments, or your investment is short-term or tied to a certain date.As for the long-term investment, Bitcoin has historically proven to be an excellent long-term investment, and this applies to a few cryptocurrencies, but I do not advise you to stay away from investing.A policy of 30% stablecoins, 40% Bitcoin, 19% Ethereum and the rest for a few investments seems like a good idea to me.30% stablecoins? Wouldn't that be too risky? I have the courage to interact with stablecoins only to quickly and quickly convert crypto to stablecoins and back to crypto. The latest events related to stablecoins are still fresh in my memory and, moreover, I don't trust any of the currently existing stablecoins. $30k portfolio I would distribute between btc and eth, rather in a ratio of 3 to 1, and 10-20% may be used to buy very risky assets. But this is not investment advice, but only my hypothetical reasoning.

comments.author: sayaya17
comments.body: Quote from: yuriagpalo on August 23, 2022, 07:25:33 AMHey guys, just wanna ask, what do you think is the best crypto portfolio for a $30k fund?Cheers!For a newbie like you, you should just focus on investing in top coins, such as Bitcoin, Ethereum and BNB are the best choices for you to buyright now. And you should not try investing in new projects first, because the risk is too big, you can lose your entire capital. Because investing in new projects requires good research and analysis skills, so you know when to buy and sell coins. But I suggest you don't use your entire $30k capital at once, because crypto market movements are very volatile and difficult to predict. So the maximum profit will be generated if you buy crypto gradually, meaning that every time the crypto price drops you can buy it. Then don't stop to learn about the crypto world, because it is very important that you know how the crypto world works. So you understand what you are buying with the money you have, let alone your capital is very large for a newbie, so you have to invest in the right coins.
